comment.author: 72347661@N02
comment._content:
This is a highly interesting photo
Just visible is the McCook Field test number P-144 which identifies the aircraft as AS.94102 on a master list prepared by Peter Bowers many years ago from a list issued by the Field in 1922 . The actual serial number on the fuselage looks like 9403 which of course is impossible. If we then look closer on the McCook master list we find that P-143 was AS.94103. Since we also know that this master list DO contain errors, it is highly possible that P-143 and P-144 should be switched and P-143 in fact was AS.94102 and P-144 should read AS.94103. A bit puzzling is the year 1918 written on the photo, since P-143/144 were issued in 1919.
Stig
